00027 
00028 #include "kvi_settings.h"
00029 
00030 
00031 //
00032 // Base class for all IRC crypt engines
00033 // These intend to encrypt plain text into something
00034 // that can be sent through the IRC protocol...
00035 // so it should not contain NULL, CR, LF and other
00036 // similar stuff...
00037 //
00038 
00039 
00040 #include "KviHeapObject.h"
00041 
00042 #include <QObject>
00043 
00044 class KviCString;
00045 
00046 #ifdef COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00047         class KviCryptEngine;
00048 
00049         typedef KviCryptEngine * (*crypt_engine_allocator_func)();
00050         typedef void (*crypt_engine_deallocator_func)(KviCryptEngine *);
00051 #endif //COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00052 
00053         // we must include this declaration to make moc happy even
00054         // if we're not compiling the crypt support
00055 
00056         class KVILIB_API KviCryptEngine : public QObject, public KviHeapObject
00057         {
00058                 Q_OBJECT
00059                 friend class KviCryptEngineManager;
00060         public:
00061                 enum EngineFlag {
00062                         CanEncrypt     = 1,
00063                         CanDecrypt     = 2,
00064                         WantEncryptKey = 4,
00065                         WantDecryptKey = 8
00066                 };
00067                 
00068                 enum EncryptResult {
00069                         Encrypted,
00070                         Encoded,
00071                         EncryptError
00072                 };
00073                 
00074                 enum DecryptResult {
00075                         DecryptOkWasEncrypted,
00076                         DecryptOkWasEncoded,
00077                         DecryptOkWasPlainText,
00078                         DecryptError
00079                 };
00080 
00081                 KviCryptEngine();
00082                 virtual ~KviCryptEngine();
00083 
00084 #ifdef COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00085         private:
00086                 crypt_engine_deallocator_func m_deallocFunc;    // this is accessed by KviCryptEngineManager only
00087                 QString                       m_szLastError;
00088                 int                           m_iMaxEncryptLen;
00089         public:
00090                 void setMaxEncryptLen(int m){ m_iMaxEncryptLen = m; };
00091                 int maxEncryptLen(){ return m_iMaxEncryptLen; };
00092                 virtual bool init(const char * encKey,int encKeyLen,const char * decKey,int decKeyLen);
00093                 //
00094                 // Encrypts utf8 plainText and returns the encrypted
00095                 // data in outBuffer. The encrypted data must be
00096                 // suitable for sending thru an IRC (eventually DCC
00097                 // that is less restrictive) connection and must be utf8 encoded: so
00098                 // no NULL, CR and LF in the output.
00099                 // 0x01 should be also avoided since
00100                 // it is the CTCP delimiter.
00101                 // Converting the result in a HEX string
00102                 // is a good trick...also Base64 could be used.
00103                 // Should return false in case of an error.
00104                 // Theoretically we could allow NULLs in plainText
00105                 // but this is not the case of KVIrc.
00106                 //
00107                 virtual EncryptResult encrypt(const char * plainText,KviCString &outBuffer);
00108                 //
00109                 // Decrypts the utf8 data in inBuffer and puts the decrypted utf8
00110                 // stuff in plainText. inBuffer is the thingie
00111                 // that we got from outBuffer of encrupt() so it
00112                 // follows the same rules.
00113                 // Should return false in case of error.
00114                 //
00115                 virtual DecryptResult decrypt(const char * inBuffer,KviCString &plainText);
00116                 //
00117                 // Returns the string containing the description
00118                 // of the last error or an empty string if there
00119                 // was no error after the last init() call.
00120                 //
00121                 const QString & lastError(){ return m_szLastError; };
00122         protected:
00123                 //
00124                 // The following two should have clear meaning
00125                 //
00126                 void clearLastError(){ m_szLastError = ""; };
00127                 void setLastError(const QString &err){ m_szLastError = err; };
00128 #endif //COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00129         };
00130 
00131 #endif // _KVI_CRYPT_ENGINE_H_
